data.title: Cat Age in Human Years
data.statement:
A cat reaches the approximate human age of 15 during its first year, then 24 at age two. Each year after, it ages approximately four "cat years" for every calendar year. This means that a five-year-old feline would be approximately 36 in cat years. **

How old are these cats in human years ?



** Source: https://www.hartz.com/calculating-your-cats-age/

testCases.title: Kittens!! - Test 3
testCases.testOut: Patrick is just a little baby

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testOut: Little-Baby-Kitty is just a little baby

testCases.title: I'll have what she's having - Test 8

data.constraints:
[[catName]] is always one word
[[catYears]] is an integer
0 ≤ [[catYears]] ≤ 38 (because the world's oldest cat lived to 38)
data.stubGenerator:
read catNameAndAge:string(256)
write Human Age of Cat
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string in the format of [[catName]] {{is}} [[catYears]], where [[catYears]] is how old the cat really is
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string in the format of
[[catName]] {{is just a little baby}} (if the cat is less than 1)
or
[[catName]] {{is like a}} [[humanYears]]{{-year-old person}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A cat reaches the approximate human age of 15 during its first year, then 24 at age two. Each year after, it ages approximately four "cat years" for every calendar year. This means that a five-year-old feline would be approximately 36 in cat years. **

How old are these cats in human years ?



** Source: https://www.hartz.com/calculating-your-cats-age/
Input
Line 1: A string in the format of catName is catYears, where catYears is how old the cat really is
Output
Line 1: A string in the format of
catName is just a little baby (if the cat is less than 1)
or
catName is like a humanYears-year-old person
Constraints
catName is always one word
catYears is an integer
0 ≤ catYears ≤ 38 (because the world's oldest cat lived to 38)
Example
Input
Miss-Kitty is 5
Output
Miss-Kitty is like a 36-year-old person
